results.title: Banquet of life
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and James Murray
results.brief_description: Examines the challenge facing man from food shortages and over population in many parts of the world. Questions whether the solution lies in increased food productivity or in control of the birth rate. Much filming was done in Guatemala and Costa Rica.
results.description: Examines the challenge facing man from food shortages and over population in many parts of the world. Questions whether the solution lies in increased food productivity or in control of the birth rate. Much filming was done in Guatemala and Costa Rica.

results.title: Bannerfilm
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: Norman Laliberte, one of the most creative designers of banners in North America is shown in his workroom piecing, stitching together, from pieces of varicoloured fabric, figures and symbols reminiscent of ancient pomp and pageantry. Music and movement are used in the film to heighten the effect of the arrangement shaping and growing before your eyes.

results.title: Banksia Serrata
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which looks at a species of native tree, growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Sound is of a solo flute mixed with native bird calls. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Banksia Integrifolia
results.brief_description: Banksia intergrifolia: a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Explores the patterns of the characteristic serrated leaves, then buds slowly maturing over many months into nectar-laden flowers. These slowly change to woody “Banksia men” cones. The sound track features a duet of two noisy Friars imitating a pair of Wattle Birds. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Banker's day
results.brief_description: This film looks at how Australian trading banks function, and the services provide for their clients.
results.description: This film looks at how Australian trading banks function, and the services provide for their clients.

results.title: Bank of England
results.creator_credit: Films of Today, Bank of England, John Wiles and John Spencer
results.brief_description: An account of the history and day-to-day functions of the Bank of England and its role in financing Government and industry. Ludovic Kennedy, the presenter, explains the Bank’s role as Government broker and banker, its tasks in issuing Treasury bills, exercising exchange control, keeping the gold reserves, acting as banker to the major clearing banks and printing the country’s supply of banknotes.

results.title: Banjo Paterson: the bush balladeer
results.brief_description: Scenes from the Australian high country and the recogniseable voice of Leonard Teale bring sixteen of Banjo Paterson’s stories to life. Included on this tape are; “Clancy of the overflow”, “The Man from Ironbark”, “Waltzing Matilda”, “Santa in the bush”, “Swagman’s rest”, “Mulga Bill’s bicycle”, “The Melting of the snow”, “The Man from Snowy River”, “The Road to Gundagai”, “Ghost of the murderer’s hut”, “The Pearl diver”, “The Geebung polo club”, “In re a gentleman one”, “The Amateur rider”, A Mountain station”, and “The Bush christening”. There are short interludes between each story to allow discussion, as a well as a brief introduction about Banjo Paterson before the stories are recounted.

results.title: Banjo's Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Banjo’s Australia explains A.B. Paterson’s contribution to Australian literature from the 1890’s to World War 1. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie, and the pathos and humour of bush life.
results.description: Banjo’s Australia explains A.B. Paterson’s contribution to Australian literature from the 1890’s to World War 1. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie, and the pathos and humour of bush life.

results.title: Bangkok Hilton
results.creator_credit: Kennedy Miller Productions, Terry Hayes, Doug Mitchell, George Miller and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: 6 episode television mini series about young Australian outback heiress Katrina Stanton (Nicole Kidman) who, after her mother’s death learns that her father, supposedly dead, is in fact alive and living overseas. She sets out on a journey from outback Australia to London to trace him. Her London uncle, initially aloof, finally reveals that her father (Denholm Elliott) resides in Bangkok and has contact with him through the family solicitor there. While staying in London, Katrina is seduced by suave young drug dealer Arkie Ragan, who offers to accompany her to Australia via Bangkok and help her contact her father. He hides 8kg of heroin in her suitcase and she is arrested at Bangkok airport. Taken to the notorious “Bangkok Hilton”, she fights to survive conditions in the women’s prison while awaiting her trial, her only support being the family solicitor Richard Carlisle (Hugo Weaving) and, unknown to Katrina, her father who acts as the associate on the case. All legal channels are exhausted when Katrina is sentenced to death, and her only hope for survival is escape. This forces her father to confront some of his own demons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kennedy Miller Productions, Terry Hayes, Doug Mitchell, George Miller and Ken Cameron

results.title: Bangers. Feeling sexy
results.creator_credit: Binnaburra Film Company, Pacific Film and Television Commission., Andrew Upton, Cate Blanchett, Glenys Rowe and Davida Allen
results.brief_description: Bangers (1998, 9 min)- Julie-Anne (Cate Blanchett) comes home from a hard day at the office to discover that her mother (Lynette Curran) has locked the cat in the house all day and that she is expected to cook ‘bangers’ for dinner. Preparing the meal becomes a manifestation of all the repressed tension in Julie-Anne’s work and home life. “Feeling sexy” (1998, 50 min)- This film is renowned painter Davida Allen’s first feature film. Vicki (Susie Porter) is a passionate and vivacious artist whose love for lust and life is slowly being stifled by domestic doldrums. Unable to elicit appropriate responses from her doctor husband Greg (Tamblyn Lord), Vicki embarks on a carnal affair with art student Hugo. When Vicki confesses her indiscretion to Greg, punishment comes in the shape of a blue-heeler who nearly destroys the house and Vicki’s psyche. Novelty being the spice of life, Vicki will have to call on all the resources of her creativity and imagination to coax Greg along on the path to restoring their relationship.
